entries.meaning: (algebraic geometry, category theory) An epimorphism of group schemes that is surjective and has a finite kernel.
examples:
It is clear that if 
  
    
      
        
          G
          
            2
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle G_{2}}
  
 is connected, then two of the defining properties of an isogeny imply the third.
